  • Element
com.sun.faces.annotation

Annotation Type PropertyCategory


  • @Retention(value=SOURCE)
@Target(value=FIELD)
public @interface PropertyCategory
    Annotation that identifies a public field as being a property category instance. The field must be assignable from com.sun.rave.designtime.CategoryDescriptor. Property annotations may reference annotated property categories. For example, the property annotation 
        @Property(name="myProperty",category="myCategory")
    private String myProperty;
    contains a reference to the property category whose name is myCategory, which might be defined elsewhere as 
        @PropertyCategory("myCategory")
    public static final CategoryDescriptor MYCATEGORY = 
        new CategoryDescriptor("myCategory", "My Category", false);
    PropertyCategory must be used to annotate only publicly accessible fields or static methods of type com.sun.rave.designtime.CategoryDescriptor.

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      java.lang.String name
      This category's unique name.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.String sortKey
      This category's sort key, used to determine the order in which this category should appear in a list of categories.

    • Element Detail

      • name

        public abstract java.lang.String name
        This category's unique name. The name must be unique within the scope of the current compilation unit. This name should generally be exactly equal to the value of CategoryDescriptor.getName(). If it is not, category descriptors inherited from external libraries will not be comparable to category descriptors defined in the current compilation unit.

      • sortKey

        public abstract java.lang.String sortKey
        This category's sort key, used to determine the order in which this category should appear in a list of categories. If not specified, the sort key defaults to the value of name().

        The collation sequence used for ordering is not specified.

        Default:
        ""
